{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3001256,"name":"Blake Bourque","username":"techplex","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/techplex/{size}/195570_2.png","created_at":"2022-02-01T16:57:50.056Z","cooked":"

Does anyone know if the Limelight POE is compatible with the REV Radio Power module?

The Limelight documentation says “Just supply 12V by wiring the passive POE injector right into your PDP.”
https://docs.limelightvision.io/en/latest/frequently_asked_questions.html?highlight=poe#does-limelight-support-active-poe

It sounds like the Radio Power Module is “Compatible with other devices that accept 18V passive POE”

REV Robotics

Radio Power Module

REV Robotics designs, builds and manufactures robotics parts and components used by students for learning about science, technology, engineering, and math (STEM). Our parts are commonly used within the FIRST Robotics Competition and the FIRST Tech...

No, do not use it for this purpose.
https://docs.limelightvision.io/en/latest/getting_started.html#wiring

Screenshot from 2022-02-01 12-12-191920×1080 442 KB

The limelight uses 12 volts, not 18 volts. Even if you use a 12v POE, for example from CTRE’s vrm, the limelight draws far too much amperage for this to work. The radio draws about 1 amp, the limelight documentation says it needs at least a 5 amp breaker.
